title: Hip-Hop, Poetics and Politics
description: Dynamics of hip-hop culture, its historical development, political significance, and social influence. How hip-hop exemplifies cross-cultural hybridization within not only Black communities nationally and internationally, but also amongst indigenous, Latino/a, and Asian peoples in the U.S. and beyond. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE D5 except for Comparative Ethnic Studies majors. Fulfills USCP.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area A and two lower division courses in Area D
recommended: ES 112 (D1) and/or ES D3 courses; Junior standing
